decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponent's spells, destroying their lands, and drawing cards to maintain card advantage. It also utilizes companions for additional benefits and efficient removal spells to deal with threats. The deck aims to outlast the opponent by disrupting their game plan and slowly gaining advantage over time. It relies on a combination of removal, counter spells, and card advantage to control the board and ultimately win the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing a wide variety of removal spells and disruptive cards to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By playing a high number of versatile threats and answers, it aims to establish dominance on the board and dictate the pace of the match. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value and flexibility in the late game, ensuring that the deck can grind out victories through attrition and strategic decision-making. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's color requirements and maximize consistency in casting spells.

The main idea of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Duress and Thoughtseize, while also removing threats with cards like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse. It also aims to control the board with creatures like Cecil, Dark Knight and Shiko, Paragon of the Way, while generating card advantage with cards like Jace Reawakened and Nashi, Searcher in the Dark. The mana base is built to support the Esper colors and ensure consistency in casting spells.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. With a mix of board wipes, card draw, and disruptive spells, the deck aims to out-value the opponent and maintain control of the game. By utilizing cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, the deck can generate card advantage and hinder the opponent's ability to develop their board. The deck also has a companion, Kaheera, the Orphanguard, to provide additional value and synergy with its creature cards.

The deck focuses on assembling Lotus Field with the help of cards like Crumbling Vestige and Nature's Rhythm to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It aims to use cards like Scapeshift and Stock Up to dig through the deck and find combo pieces to win the game. Other cards like Glimpse the Core and Aftermath Analyst provide additional card advantage. The deck also includes some interaction with cards like Thassa's Oracle for a possible alternate win condition. It's all about maximizing mana efficiency and combo potential to overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through hand disruption cards like Duress and Thoughtseize, removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, and powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil. It also utilizes cards that provide card advantage like Graveyard Trespasser and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The deck aims to control the game by keeping the opponent's board clear while generating incremental advantage with its card advantage engines, ultimately overpowering the opponent with its powerful threats like Sheoldred and Liliana. The mana base is streamlined with a focus on black sources to ensure consistency in casting the deck's spells.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures and utilizing burn spells to deal damage to the opponent. With a mix of powerful creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Emberheart Challenger, alongside burn spells like Lightning Strike and Burst Lightning, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless assault. The inclusion of cards like Den of the Bugbear and Ramunap Ruins provide additional reach and damage potential. Overall, this deck seeks to end the game quickly by applying pressure and burning the opponent's life total down.

This aggressive red deck focuses on using low-cost creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also includes creatures with abilities that pump up their power, like Emberheart Challenger and Heartfire Hero. The deck aims to maintain pressure on opponents by constantly attacking and using burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage to clear blockers and finish off opponents. The inclusion of Manifold Mouse and Mutavault provide additional creature options and the potential for evasion with land creatures. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast, efficient damage output.

The main focus of this Esper Control deck is to consistently control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and card advantage. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent with cards like Treacherous Blessing and Yorion, Sky Nomad, while also presenting threats like Sunpearl Kirin and Nurturing Pixie to close out the game. The mana base is built to support the three-color requirements of the deck, allowing for flexibility in casting spells across different colors.

The main strategy of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, and powerful creatures like Graveyard Trespasser and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The deck also aims to generate card advantage with cards like Castle Locthwain and Liliana of the Veil, while also having a strong land destruction package with Field of Ruin and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth. The overall goal is to outvalue the opponent and control the game until victory is achieved.

The main concept of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand and board state using cards like Duress, Thoughtseize, and Liliana of the Veil, while also having removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to deal with threats. The deck aims to control the game using powerful planeswalkers and creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Graveyard Trespasser, while using cards like Unholy Annex/Ritual Chamber to gain value over time. Additionally, the deck has a strong midrange game plan with Gifted Aetherborn and finishers like Blade of the Oni.

This deck focuses on using Retraction Helix in combination with cheap artifacts and creatures to create powerful, repetitive looping combos. The key strategy is to generate mana quickly with Mox Amber and other mana sources, while filtering through the deck with card draw spells like Sleight of Hand and Consider. By constantly bouncing and recasting creatures like Rona, Herald of Invasion and Cori-Steel Cutter, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with efficient threats and card advantage, ultimately leading to victory through combo synergy and tempo advantage.

The key concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent by utilizing efficient removal spells and aggressive creatures with the ability to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Duress, while also deploying threats like Bloodtithe Harvester and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to close out the game quickly. The inclusion of cards like Fear of Missing Out and Blightstep Pathway further enhances the deck's aggressive strategy, making it difficult for the opponent to stabilize and turn the game in their favor.

This Red Deck Wins aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures and burn spells. It utilizes cards like Burst Lightning, Lightning Strike, and Reckless Rage to efficiently deal damage to both creatures and opponents. The deck also includes versatile creatures like Emberheart Challenger and Kumano Faces Kakkazan to maintain board presence. With a mix of direct damage spells and efficient creatures, this deck aims to finish games quickly before opponents can stabilize. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Mutavault and Monstrous Rage provide additional ways to push through damage and close out games.

The main idea behind this Esper Control deck is to utilize a wide range of removal spells, disruptive cards, and card advantage engines to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By combining powerful control cards with a companion like Yorion, Sky Nomad for additional value, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while slowly building up its own resources advantage. The deck also includes a variety of lands to ensure consistent access to its three-color mana base, allowing for a versatile and adaptable control strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly applying pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. It aims to control the board by using removal and hand disruption while steadily lowering the opponent's life total. The deck includes a mix of versatile threats like Bloodtithe Harvester, Kroxa, and Sheoldred, alongside efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat. The mana base is optimized for consistency and provides access to both black and red mana sources. Overall, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless onslaught of threats and disruption.
